The plot shows peaks where the red bars are likely to be. By looking at the plot, we can identify four significant peaks which correspond to the red bars for each season. The exact column locations of these peaks will be used to measure the heights of the red bars in pixels.

Next, I will pinpoint the exact pixel locations of these peaks to get the pixel heights of the red bars for Spring, Summer, and Autumn. Then, I can estimate their values based on the given value for Winter. Let's identify these locations and calculate the corresponding values.
